name: Sky
description: Interact with built-in Sky & Weather system.

static_functions.name: Spawn
static_functions.description: Replaces all Sky/Sun actors with the Ultra Dynamic Sky Actor, to be able to use the functions from this page
static_functions.description_long: Replaces all Sky/Sun actors with the Ultra Dynamic Sky Actor, to be able to use the functions from this page. Internally this calls Sky.DestroyAllSky() automatically

parameters.name: spawn_weather
parameters.description: Whether or not to spawn the Weather Actor (to be able to use Weather related methods)

static_functions.name: DestroyAllSky
static_functions.description: Destroys all Directional Lights, Sky Lights, Exponential Height Fogs, Volumetric Clouds, Sky Atmosphere, Ultra Dynamic Sky Actors and all Actors with the Sun Actor Tag from the Level

static_functions.name: SetCloudCoverage
static_functions.description: The amount of coverage for the cloud layer, from a clear sky to overcast

static_functions.name: SetFog
static_functions.description: The fogginess of the scene. The impact this has on fog density is scaled from the Fog Density category

static_functions.name: SetContrast
static_functions.description: A simple contrast boost for the sky material. Cannot affect volumetric clouds

static_functions.name: SetOverallIntensity
static_functions.description: The overall brightness of the shader

static_functions.name: SetNightBrightness
static_functions.description: Can be used to scale the brightness of the sky and lighting, at night

static_functions.name: SetAnimateTimeOfDay
static_functions.description: Sets whether or not to animate the time of day

parameters.name: animate
parameters.description: Whether or not to animate the time of day

parameters.name: day_length
parameters.description: The time (in minutes) from sunrise to sunset

parameters.name: night_length
parameters.description: The time (in minutes) from sunset to sunrise

parameters.name: transition_time
parameters.description: fade time to completely change to new weather
